name: The Millennium Memory Project
description: It began with a simple question: Do you remember where you were and what you were doing on the night of December 31, 1999? It became a hybrid work of data journalism and oral history, and a fascinating look at our memories from the turn of the millennium.
skills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, D3.js, AngularJS, Illustrator, Premier Pro, Audition, Qualtrics (survey software), Mechanical Turk
fileUnder: web development, journalism, data visualization, graphic design, audio, video

name: The Best-Selling Writers of All Time
description: The list of best-selling fiction authors of all time reads like a potboiler in its own right; it's full of surprise and intrigue. Three of the top four in the list are women, and you've probably never heard of one of them. One writer in the chart admitted to plagiarizing another in 1997. Another author was killed in a duel. Dive in with this interactive infographic.

name: CIA Data: In Bubbles
description: The CIA created the World Factbook as a classified document in 1962. They released it to the public in 1971, and it's now one of the leading sources of statistics on each of the world's 195 sovereign nations and 59 dependent territories. This website is a visualization of that data.
skills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, D3.js, AngularJS

name: 2016 U.S. Senate Elections
description: As the U.S. Senate elections approached in 2016, I wondered: How many of the candidates went to Harvard? How many of them were lawyers? This interactive app provided answers to those questions and more.

name: How The Money Moves
description: I built this website as a project at UNC. I had two goals: 1) Produce a work of data journalism with at least three visualizations; and 2) emulate the style of a major news publication. To accomplish the first goal, I combed through U.S. census data and found some interesting trends in the migration patterns of Americans at different income levels. For the second objective, I chose to emulate the style of FiveThirtyEight (as it looked in fall 2015). The resemblance is purely for educational purposes.
skills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, HighCharts.js, cartoDB

name: Fingers: Fact & Fiction
description: Ever wonder where the word 'pinky' comes from? Why do most people wear wedding rings on the third finger of their left hand? The answers to these questions and more can be found in this interactive slider.

name: What I'm Probably Doing Right Now
description: I'm a private investigator, freelance journalist, and the father of three kids. My schedule varies widely depending on the day and time. So I built working, analog SVG clock that updates my status.

name: A Lesson In Honeysuckle
description: You can find some interesting things in the woods. Like a memory from your childhood.
